alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 22 at 11:53AM CDT until July 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Eastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Southwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/. * At 1253 PM EDT/1153 AM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Headland, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Headland, Blakely, Kinsey, Ashford, Webb, Columbia, Gordon, Haleburg, Pansey, Tumbleton, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Pearce, Enon, Rock Hill, Barber, Pleasant Plains, Headland Municipal A/P, Miller and Farley Nuclear Plant. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
